result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric J. Riggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed, defendant is specifically NOT granted huber priveleges but is granted 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court. Sentence if imposed is to run consecutive to stayed sentence in 15CM61.
Consecutive to: Stayed sentence  in 15CM32 & 15CM61 if imposed is to run consecutive to each .
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office upon release from jail.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. Bond of $150.00 applied.
10-7-2015 Stayed sentence imposed, defendant granted 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Savannah Cook  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Exception for 3rd party contact is granted no more than 2 times weekly solely for the purpose of child visitation.

The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.  
The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer at any time without cause.

timeConds.notes: Defendant NOT granted huber privileges but granted credit for 27 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY
Status conference on March 12, 2015 at 03:10 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with S.C. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant may go through a third party no more than 3 times to make arrangements for picking up personal belongings.
***RE: CASH BOND POSTED:  It is the Court's understanding that the money posted in this case is enroute from Jackson County Sheriff's Department.  If money is not received by the Clark County Clerk of Court by 2/29/15, defendant is to post $150.00 to the Clark County Clerk of Court.
